action.action-desc: Ms. Eddie Bernice Johnson of Texas (for herself, Mr. Rodriguez, Ms. Corrine Brown of Florida, Mrs. Capps, Mrs. McCarthy of New York, and Mr. Burgess) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to enhance the capacity of the Department of Veterans Affairs to recruit and retain nurses and other critical health-care professionals, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Veterans' Medical Personnel Recruitment and Retention Act of 2008.

section.header: Enhancement of authorities for retention of medical professionals

subsection.header: Secretarial authority to extend title 38 status to additional positions

paragraph.text: Paragraph (3) of section 7401 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by striking and blind rehabilitation outpatient specialists. and inserting the following: “blind rehabilitation outpatient specialists, and such other classes of health care occupations as the Secretary considers necessary for the recruitment and retention needs of the Department subject to the following requirements:

subparagraph.text: Not later than 45 days before the Secretary appoints any personnel for a class of health care occupations that is not specifically listed in this paragraph, the Secretary shall submit to the Committee on Veterans' Affairs of the Senate, the Committee on Veterans' Affairs of the House of Representatives, and the Office of Management and Budget notice of such appointment.
Before submitting notice under subparagraph (A), the Secretary shall solicit comments from any labor organization representing employees in such class and include such comments in such notice.

paragraph.text: Such paragraph is further amended by inserting nurse assistants, after licensed practical or vocational nurses,.

subsection.header: Probationary periods for nurses
subsection.text: Section 7403(b) of such title is amended—

paragraph.text: by redesignating paragraph (2) as paragraph (4); and
by inserting after paragraph (1) the following new paragraphs:

An appointment of a nurse under this chapter, whether on a full-time basis or a part-time basis, shall be for a probationary period ending upon the completion by the person so appointed of 4,180 hours of work pursuant to such appointment.

An appointment described in subsection (a) on a part-time basis of a person who has previously served on a full-time basis for the probationary period for the position concerned shall be without a probationary period.

subsection.header: Prohibition on temporary part-time nurse appointments in excess of 4,180 hours
subsection.text: Section 7405(f)(2) of such title is amended by inserting after year the following: , except that a part-time appointment of a nurse shall not exceed 4,180 hours.

subsection.header: Waiver of offset from pay for certain reemployed annuitants

paragraph.text: Section 7405 of such title is amended by adding at the end the following:

The Secretary may waive the application of sections 8344 and 8468 of title 5 (relating to annuities and pay on reemployment) or any other similar provision of law under a Government retirement system on a case-by-case basis for an annuitant reemployed on a temporary basis under the authority of subsection (a) in a position described under paragraph (1) of that subsection.
An annuitant to whom a waiver under paragraph (1) is in effect shall not be considered an employee for purposes of any Government retirement system.

An annuitant to whom a waiver under paragraph (1) is in effect shall be subject to the provisions of chapter 71 of title 5 (including all labor authority and labor representative collective bargaining agreements) applicable to the position to which appointed.
In this subsection:

subparagraph.text: The term annuitant means an annuitant under a Government retirement system.
The term employee has the meaning under section 2105 of title 5.
The term Government retirement system means a retirement system established by law for employees of the Government of the United States.

paragraph.text: The amendment made by paragraph (1) shall take effect on the date that is six months after the date of the enactment of this Act, and shall apply to pay periods beginning on or after such effective date.

subsection.header: Minimum rate of basic pay for appointees to the Office of the Under Secretary for Health set to lowest rate of basic pay payable for a Senior Executive Service position

paragraph.text: Section 7404(a) of such title is amended—

subparagraph.text: by striking The annual and inserting (1) The annual;
by striking The pay and inserting the following:

paragraph.text: The pay

subparagraph.text: by striking under the preceding sentence and inserting under paragraph (1); and
by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: The minimum rate of basic pay for a position to which an Executive order applies under paragraph (1) and is not described by paragraph (2) may not be less than the lowest rate of basic pay payable for a Senior Executive Service position under section 5382 of title 5.
The amendments made by paragraph (1) shall take effect on the first day of the first pay period beginning after the day that is 180 days after the date of the enactment of this Act.

subsection.header: Comparability pay program for appointees to the Office of the Under Secretary for Health
subsection.text: Section 7410 of such title is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking The Secretary may and inserting (a) In general.—The Secretary may; and
by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Comparability pay for appointees to the Office of the Under Secretary for Health

paragraph.text: The Secretary may authorize the Under Secretary for Health to provide comparability pay of not more than $100,000 per year to individuals of the Veterans Health Administration appointed under section 7306 of this title who are not physicians or dentists to achieve annual pay levels for such individuals that are comparable with annual pay levels of individuals with similar positions in the private sector.
Comparability pay under paragraph (1) for an individual is in addition to all other pay, awards, and performance bonuses paid to such individual under this title.

Except as provided in paragraph (4), comparability pay under paragraph (1) for an individual shall be considered basic pay for all purposes, including retirement benefits under chapters 83 and 84 of title 5, and other benefits.
Comparability pay under paragraph (1) for an individual shall not be considered basic pay for purposes of adverse actions under subchapter V of this chapter.

Comparability pay under paragraph (1) may not be awarded to an individual in an amount that would result in an aggregate amount of pay (including bonuses and awards) received by such individual in a year under this title that is greater than the annual pay of the President.

subsection.header: Special incentive pay for Department pharmacist executives
subsection.text: Section 7410 of such title, as amended by subsection (f), is further amended by adding at the end the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Special incentive pay for Department pharmacist executives

paragraph.text: In order to recruit and retain highly qualified Department pharmacist executives, the Secretary may authorize the Under Secretary for Health to pay special incentive pay of not more than $40,000 per year to an individual of the Veterans Health Administration who is a pharmacist executive.
In determining whether and how much special pay to provide to such individual, the Under Secretary shall consider the following:

subparagraph.text: The grade and step of the position of the individual.
The scope and complexity of the position of the individual.
The personal qualifications of the individual.
The characteristics of the labor market concerned.
Such other factors as the Secretary considers appropriate.

paragraph.text: Special incentive pay under paragraph (1) for an individual is in addition to all other pay (including basic pay) and allowances to which the individual is entitled.

Except as provided in paragraph (5), special incentive pay under paragraph (1) for an individual shall be considered basic pay for all purposes, including retirement benefits under chapters 83 and 84 of title 5, and other benefits.
Special incentive pay under paragraph (1) for an individual shall not be considered basic pay for purposes of adverse actions under subchapter V of this chapter.

Special incentive pay under paragraph (1) may not be awarded to an individual in an amount that would result in an aggregate amount of pay (including bonuses and awards) received by such individual in a year under this title that is greater than the annual pay of the President.

subsection.header: Pay for physicians and dentists

paragraph.header: Non-foreign cost of living adjustment allowance
paragraph.text: Section 7431(b) of such title is amended by adding at the end the following:

The non-foreign cost of living adjustment allowance authorized under section 5941 of title 5 for physicians and dentists whose pay is set under this section shall be determined as a percentage of base pay only.

paragraph.header: Market pay determinations for physicians and dentists in administrative or executive leadership positions
paragraph.text: Section 7431(c)(4)(B)(i) of such title is amended by adding at the end the following: The Secretary may exempt physicians and dentists occupying administrative or executive leadership positions from the requirements of the previous sentence..

paragraph.header: Exception to prohibition on reduction of market pay

subsection.text: Section 7451(c)(2) of such title is amended by striking title 5 and inserting title 5 or the level of GS–15 as prescribed under section 5332 of such title, whichever is greater.

subsection.header: Exemption for certified registered nurse anesthetists from limitation on authorized competitive pay

subsection.header: Locality pay scale computations

paragraph.header: Education, training, and support for facility directors in wage surveys
paragraph.text: Section 7451(d)(3) of such title is amended by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.text: The Under Secretary for Health shall provide appropriate education, training, and support to directors of Department health-care facilities in the conduct and use of surveys under this paragraph.

paragraph.header: Information on methodology used in wage surveys
paragraph.text: Section 7451(e)(4) of such title is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating subparagraph (D) as subparagraph (E); and
by inserting after subparagraph (C) the following new subparagraph (D):

In any case in which the director conducts such a wage survey during the period covered by the report and makes adjustment in rates of basic pay applicable to one or more covered positions at the facility, information on the methodology used in making such adjustment or adjustments.

paragraph.header: Disclosure of information to persons in covered positions
paragraph.text: Section 7451(e) of such title is further amended by adding at the end the following new paragraph:

subparagraph.text: Upon the request of an individual described in subparagraph (B) for a report provided under paragraph (4) with respect to a Department health-care facility, the Under Secretary for Health or the director of such facility shall provide to the individual the most current report for such facility provided under such paragraph.
An individual described in this subparagraph is—

clause.text: an individual in a covered position at a Department health-care facility; or
a representative of the labor organization representing that individual who is designated by that individual to make the request.

subsection.text: Section 7452(g)(2) of such title is amended by striking $25,000 and inserting $100,000.

paragraph.header: Exclusion of application of additional nurse pay provisions to certain additional employees
paragraph.text: Section 7454(b)(3) of such title is amended to read as follows:

Employees appointed under section 7408 of this title performing service on a tour of duty, any part of which is within the period commencing at midnight Friday and ending at midnight Sunday, shall receive additional pay in addition to the rate of basic pay provided such employees for each hour of service on such tour at a rate equal to 25 percent of such employee's hourly rate of basic pay.

subsection.text: Section 7455(c)(1) of such title is amended by inserting after nurse anesthetists, the following: licensed practical nurses, licensed vocational nurses, and nursing positions otherwise covered by title 5,.

section.header: Limitations on overtime duty, weekend duty, and alternative work schedules for nurses

subsection.header: Overtime duty

paragraph.text: Subchapter IV of chapter 74 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by adding at the end the following new section:

section.header: Nurses: special rules for overtime duty

subsection.header: Limitation
subsection.text: Except as provided in subsection (c), the Secretary may not require a nurse to work more than 40 hours (or 24 hours if such nurse is covered under section 7456) in an administrative work week or more than eight consecutive hours (or 12 hours if such nurse is covered under section 7456 or 7456A).

subsection.header: Voluntary overtime

paragraph.text: A nurse may on a voluntary basis elect to work hours otherwise prohibited by subsection (a).

The refusal of a nurse to work hours prohibited by subsection (a) shall not be grounds to discriminate (within the meaning of section 704(a) of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 (42 U.S.C. 2000e–3(a))) against the nurse, dismissal or discharge of the nurse, or any other adverse personnel action against the nurse.

subsection.header: Overtime under emergency circumstances

paragraph.text: Subject to paragraph (2), the Secretary may require a nurse to work hours otherwise prohibited by subsection (a) if—

subparagraph.text: the work is a consequence of an emergency that could not have been reasonably anticipated;
the Secretary has exhausted all good faith, reasonable attempts to obtain voluntary workers;
the nurse has critical skills and expertise that are required for the work; and
the work involves work for which the standard of care for a patient assignment requires continuity of care through completion of a case, treatment, or procedure.

paragraph.text: A nurse may not be required to work hours under this subsection after the requirement for a direct role by the nurse in responding to medical needs resulting from the emergency ends.

subsection.header: Nurse defined
subsection.text: In this section, the term nurse includes the following;

paragraph.text: A registered nurse.
A licensed practical or vocational nurse.
A nurse assistant appointed under this chapter or title 5.
Any other nurse position designated by the Secretary for purposes of this section.
The table of sections at the beginning of chapter 74 of such title is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 7458 the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: 7459. Nurses: special rules for overtime duty.

subsection.header: Loan repayment program for clinical researchers from disadvantaged backgrounds

paragraph.text: The Secretary of Veterans Affairs, in consultation with the Secretary of Health and Human Services, may utilize the authorities available in section 487E of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 288–5) for the repayment of the principal and interest of educational loans of appropriately qualified health professionals who are from disadvantaged backgrounds in order to secure clinical research by such professionals for the Veterans Health Administration.

The exercise by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs of the authorities referred to in paragraph (1) shall be subject to the conditions and limitations specified in paragraphs (2) and (3) of section 487E(a) of the Public Health Service Act (42 U.S.C. 288–5(2) and (3)).

Amounts for the repayment of principal and interest of educational loans under this subsection shall be derived from amounts available to the Secretary of Veterans for the Veterans Health Administration for Medical Services.
